title: The Adventures of Sue Russell: Sculptor of Justice
summary: Sue Russell, a 41-year-old advisor and sculptor turned superhero, uses her special powers to detect and sculpt realities to save her city over a tense week.
summaryGerman: Sue Russell, eine 41-jährige Beraterin und Bildhauerin, die zur Superheldin wurde, nutzt ihre speziellen Fähigkeiten, um Realitäten zu erkennen und zu formen, um ihre Stadt über eine angespannte Woche hinweg zu retten.
summaryDutch: Sue Russell, een 41-jarige adviseur en beeldhouwster die superheldin wordt, gebruikt haar speciale krachten om realiteiten te detecteren en vorm te geven om haar stad te redden gedurende een gespannen week.
summaryFrench: Sue Russell, une conseillère et sculptrice de 41 ans devenue super-héroïne, utilise ses pouvoirs spéciaux pour détecter et sculpter des réalités afin de sauver sa ville pendant une semaine tendue.

story.text: Sue discovers her powers after accidentally sculpting a statue that comes to life, vowing to use this ability to fight injustice.
Her first test comes quickly, as a local gang terrorizes a peaceful neighborhood. Sue steps in, her sculptures disrupting their plans.
Her actions from the previous day make headlines. Sue feels the weight of her new role, consulting her mentor on how to balance power and responsibility.
Inspired, she sculpts ‘Guardians of the City’—statues placed at strategic points, which come to life when danger is near.
Sue is challenged by a villain who understands her powers and tries to corrupt her sculptures. After a fierce battle, she emerges victorious, strengthening her resolve.
The city celebrates her heroics with a ceremony in her honor. During the event, Sue's sculptures symbolize safety and creativity.
Reflecting on her week, Sue returns to her studio, feeling peaceful and ready to advance her craft, centered and more powerful than ever.

moral: With great power comes the need for creativity and the responsibility to use it for good.
ending: As the sun sets, Sue Russell looks out over the city she protects, sculpture chisel in hand, ready for whatever comes next.
